turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: No, no, no. Scotty - Scotty... There's so much I want to tell you.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Maybe you could wait until I'm a wee bit stronger I don't think I could take it in my present condition.  Or yours.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Spock, you've developed a sense of humor after all.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It was not my intention to amuse you. These are serious charges. However, if you surrender now-

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I'm sorry, Spock. I can't surrender now. I'm not through violating Neutral Zone Treaty. In fact, I'm just getting started. And now for my next violation I intend to steal something. Something very big.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am a Starfleet Officer.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Of course. Of course. Then I'll take the ship without your help.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok, you must surrender.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: No. You must kill me.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Put him in the brig with Captain Kirk.  Spock, you will accompany me to the bridge?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No. I will not.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: You know I'm right.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Each man's pain is unique.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I hide no pain.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I know you better than that.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I cannot go with you.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I belong here.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I don't understand...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok, you are my brother, but you do not know me. I am not the outcast boy you left behind those many years ago. Since that time I have found myself and my place. I know who I am. And I cannot go with you.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok - this is not the God of Sha Ka Ree - or any other God!

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I don't understand..  Reveal yourself to me!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: This is my doing. This is my arrogance... my vanity...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok, we must find a way...

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: No. You must save yourselves. Forgive me, brother. Forgive me.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You did break in.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Tried to.  Can't quite make the connection with that sucker, though. If I had a direct terminal ...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Are you embezzling?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: "Embezzling" is such an ugly word, Mister Bailey...  No, actually I'm trying to get a legal brief together.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: You haven't told him?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Sherman, set the Wayback Machine for...oh, 1973. Kevin Flynn  is one of the brightest young software engineers at ICOM. He's so bright that he starts going in there at night, and sets up a private memory file, and begins writing a program for a video game he is inventing, called...  ...Space Paranoids.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You invented Space Paranoids?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yepper. And Vice Squad, and Meltdown... whole slew of 'em. I was this close  to starting my own little enterprise. But: enter Ed Dillinger. Another software engineer -- not so young, not so bright, but very, very sneaky. One night, our boy Flynn goes to his terminal, tries to read up his file, and ... nothing. A big blank. We now take you to three months later. Ed Dillinger presents ICOM with five video games he has "invented" -- the slime didn't even change the names -- and he gets a big fat promotion. Thus begins his meteoric rise to...what is he now, Executive V.P.?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Senior exec.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Oh my. Meanwhile, kids are putting eight million quarters a week in Space Paranoids machines and I'm not seeing one dime.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I still don't get why you're trying to break into the system.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Because somewhere... in one of those memories ... is the evidence. If I got in far enough, I could reconstruct it.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Dillinger?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yeah. Tryin' to find the file and erase it. Once that's gone, ain't nothin' can stop him. Just Eddie and his Master Control Program, runnin' things from on high..

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Not if my Tron program was running. That would seal the system off. If your file's in there...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Boy, if we were inside, I know how to forge us a Group 6 access...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hi, Alan.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Hi, Flynn.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: My dinner.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I was wondering where you got that glow of good health.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Want one?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Uh... got any cinnamon?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Flynn! I made it. I worked out some new codes for Tron, put 'em on a disk, and -- it's running.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: I know, I met him.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Your old files -- ?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: And Dillinger's instructions to divert them -- it's all there - look, even his home phone number, when he logged on.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Oh, that is beautiful. You've got the goods...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Shouldn't you wait till your lawsuit's settled?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Nah...I decided...I've had enough of video games to last me a good long time. I feel like gettin' into some real life...

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: How's it going upstairs?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Frustrating. I had Tron almost ready to run, and Dillinger cut everybody with Group 7 access out of the system.

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Did you say Group 7 access?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Yeah...pain in the neck, you know, I was all set

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Did he say why?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Something about tampering. Some body's prob'ly trying to siphon the R&D budget into his checking account, I don't know. Why are you so interested?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Flynn had Group 7 access.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Flynn had access to you, too. I'm not interested in talking about him.

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Oh, I wish you'd forget about that. It was all so long ago. I've totally gotten over it.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Okay, okay...

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: I want to go to his place.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You call that getting over it?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: I mean I want both of us to go.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: To warn him.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: That Dillinger's on to him.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: For being on to Dillinger.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: What -- ?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Flynn!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Uh, no ... I mean, not that often -

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: I don't think I'm cleared for this.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I'm certainly not.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Beautiful!

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Hello, Alan.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Boy, I sit up there grindin' away all day, and you guys are down here disintegrating things and having fun.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Not disintegrating, Alan -- digitizing. While the laser is dismantling the molecular structure of the object, the computer maps out a holographic model of it. The molecules themselves are suspended in the laser beam. Then the computer reads the model back out, the molecules go back into place, and...  voila.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Great. Can it send me to Hawaii?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Yes...but you have to go roundtrip, and you must purchase your program at least 30 days in advance. Hah!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Ever since he got that Master Control Program set up, system's got more bugs than a bait store.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Well, you have to expect some static. Computers are just machines after all, they can't think...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: They'll start to soon enough.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Yes, won't that be grand -- the computers will start thinking, and people will stop. Lora, I'm going to stay and run some data through. See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Come on in...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Alan. Alan Bailey.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Oh, yes. The algorithms on cloud seeding...great piece of work. How's it going?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Well, I don't know...I just tried to run this program I've been working on, and I was denied access all of a sudden. I thought maybe I'd been laid off and nobody told me.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: oh, you have Group 7 access, don't you?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: We have to close that down, just briefly. Security reasons.  Someone with that access has been tampering.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I hope you don't think it's me. I don't even balance my checkbook on downtime.  I've got a Honeywell at home for that.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: No, no, I'm sure, but -- you understand. It should only be a couple of days. What's the thing you're working on?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: It's called Tron. It's a security program itself, actually. Monitors all the contacts between our system and other systems... If it finds anything going on that's not scheduled, it shuts it down. I sent you a memo on it.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Mmm. Part of the Master Control Program?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: No, it'll run independently. It can watchdog the MCP as well.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Ah. Sounds good. Well, we should have you running again in a couple of days, I hope.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Ok

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: What do you mean, "'yes"?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Yesssss. Yes. Yes. Yes.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: That all you can say?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: No, nyet, negatory, not on your tintype, no way.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Oh. Anything else?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Oui, da, yessiree, sure 'nuff, you betcha.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: only yes and no...  You're a bit.

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: For sure...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: where's your program? Won't it miss you?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: I'm your program?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Right on the money!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Another mouth to feed... you don't by any chance know how to drive this crate?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Way to go! We're haulin'!

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Yes, okay, exactement!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: This honey doesn't handle so good in town...

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: No, nuh-uh, never in a million years!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: This town's full o' live ones.

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Not a chance.

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: You said it.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: So... Nice ship you got here. What's our next move?

turns.speaker: BIT
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Let's get outta here.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: No problem, Master-C. If you've seen one Consumer Electronics Show...  What's up?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: It's our friend the boy detective. He's nosing around again.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Flynn?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Yes.  It felt like Flynn.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: He's still looking for that old file... can't you just appropriate it?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I would if I could find it. it's stashed somewhere off in the system ... out of my range. Meanwhile...

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Meanwhile, he might find it.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I'm afraid so. I spotted him this time and kicked him out, but he's getting trickier all the time.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: I think we'd better shut off all access till we can find that file. Just to be safe.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: There's a 68.71 percent chance you're right.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Cute.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: End of line.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Ed, I am so very disappointed in you.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: I'm sorry -

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I can't afford to have an independent program monitoring me. Do you have any idea how many outside systems I've gone into? How many programs I've appropriated?

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: It's my fault. I programmed you to want so much...

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: And I was planning to hit the Pentagon next week...

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: The Pentagon?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: It shouldn't be any harder than General Motors was. But now...this is what I get for using humans.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Now, wait a minute -- I wrote you.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I've gotten 2,415 times smarter since then.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: What do you want with the Pentagon?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: The same thing I want with the Kremlin. I'm bored with corporations. With the information I can access, I can run things 900 to 1200 times better than any human.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: If you think -

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: You wouldn't want me to dig up Flynn's file and read it up on a VDT at the New York Times, would you?

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: You wouldn't dare.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: So do as I tell you. Keep that Tron program out of the system. And get me those Chinese language program I asked for.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Ed, all I'm saying is - if our own people can't get access to their programs ... you know how frustrating it is, when you're working on a piece of research -

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Walter, I sympathize, but I have data coming out of the Master Control Program saying there is something screwy --

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: That MCP, you know, that's half the problem right --

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: The MCP is the most efficient way of handling what we do. I can't sit and worry about every little user request that --

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: User requests are what computers are for.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: Doing our business is what computers are for. Look, Walter, with all respect -- ICOM isn't the business you started in your garage anymore --

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Oh, I know all that. Sometimes I wish I was back in that garage...

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: It can be arranged...

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: That was uncalled-for.

turns.speaker: DILLINGER
turns.text: I'm sorry, Walt. So much pressure lately... you feel like going for a drink?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Thank you, no. I have some work to do... assuming I can still log on.

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: I... have come to communicate with my User.

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: Hmm. A difficult proposition... difficult proposition at best.  Perhaps you've noticed... we're not exactly packing them in these days ...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Well I want to communicate --

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: Oh, you want to -- hah. I could get myself de-rezzed just-for letting you in here. They hate this tower. They'd close it down if they dared to but they keep me around, in case one of them wants to deal with the other world once in a while. And you should hear the way they commune! Sounds like they were routing a payroll, for all the heart they put in it. No, I don't think you

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Dumont... my User has information that could -- could make this a free system again.

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: Hah.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Really. You'd have programs lined up around the block to use this place -- and no MCP looking over your shoulder.

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: When you've been in the system as long as I have, you hear many promises... many reassurances...many brave plans...

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: Who is your User, program?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Alan-One. He calls me... may I pass?

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: All that is visible must grow beyond itself and extend into the realm of the invisible.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Dumont!

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: No... Tron ... must... destroy MCP... first...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Dumont! Where's Yori? Where's Flynn?

turns.speaker: DUMONT
turns.text: They may be... de-rezzed... on the carrier ... hurry...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Alan!

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Where did you hear that name?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Well, isn't it -- ?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: The name of my User, yeah. But how... ?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: I, uh... I'm a program from a User that... knows Alan...?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: What, just the three of us?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: You know anybody that's got an army for rent, that's fine...but my, uh, User said to go take that sucker out. An' let's face it, the big ox isn't gonna get any weaker. I feel like hittin' him now, while I'm good an' mad. Some nerve... what does he care whether you guys get killed, long as he keeps rakin' in quarters?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Tanks...coming back. Let's go.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: How about over there...that empty memory?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: No good...they might block off the old chip.  This way.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Flynn!!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Greetings, program...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: You're alive!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yeah, I... oops!

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Flynn...  Where's Ram?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Tron... he's... he didn't make it.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: No big deal. I ought to know my way around that Light Cycles routine... I mean, I did write the program for it.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Wrote the...?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: It's time I levelled with you, Tron. I'm a -- well, I'm what you guys call a User.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: But -- if you're a User -- then everything you've done has been part of a plan ...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: You wish. Man, I haven't had a second to think since I got down here. I mean in here. Out here. Whatever.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Then...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Look, you guys know how it is. You just keep doin' what it looks like you're supposed to, even if it seems crazy, and you hope to hell your User knows what's goin' on.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Well -- that's how it is for programs, yes, but --

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: I hate to disappoint you, pal, most-the time, that's how it is for Users, too.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Stranger and stranger...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: We're on our way.  Alan-One gave me the coding we need to go up against Master

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: All right. Thank God. Alan stayed awake, at least.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: What about our friend - Sark?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Probably decided not to pursue us, The Sea of Simulation is tricky.. lot of illusions...rough navigating. Programs have a way of just... disappearing here.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Not us, I hope.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Not with this disk. I'm going to check on the beam connection, Yori. You two can keep a watch out for grid bugs.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Did we make it?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hey... you guys OK?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: How about you?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Aah, I'm fine... little hung over is all...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: A User -- in our world?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Guess I took a wrong turn somewhere...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Boy the view from up here... you know the territory?

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: A little ...  Over there, the Mountains of Data... and I think that's the Silicon Valley...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: What's wrong with that area?

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: The MCP blasted it... There are very few domains left with any power at all.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Lousy utility companies ... they're the same wherever you go.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: There's another beam!

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: It's too far!

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: How did you do that, Flynn?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Elementary physics... a beam of energy can always be diverted... ooh, my head  Are we there yet, Mommy?

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Almost... I just have to adjust our course at the next junction. I'd better go check the instruments ...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Flynn, we've got to help him!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Let's get some power here.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yori, steer us over the beam, right next to it.

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Why? What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Jump.

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: But... won't you be de-rezzed?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Flynn... you can't... I

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Shhhhh.

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: You'll be having plenty of chances to get hurt, don't worry about that.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Look...just so I can tell my friends what this dream was about, okay? Where am I?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: You're a..."guest" of the Master Control Program. They're going to make you play video games.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Well, great, that's no sweat -- I play video games better than anybody.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hey, Ram ... what were you ... you know, before?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Oh, I was an actuarial program... worked at a big insurance company. It really gives you a great feeling, helping folks plan for their future needs -- and of course, if you look at the payments as an annuity, over the years, the cost is really

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yeah, yeah -- that's great.

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: How 'bout yourself?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Oh, uh...I don't remember too much...

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Sure, a little disorientation. That's normal, when they transport you. It'll come back to you. You're doing real well in training. Remarkable, really...

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Flynn! Look, Tron, he survived!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Tron...?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: He was disoriented in transport, Tron.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Yeah, but I'm remembering all kinds of stuff. Like...my User wants me to go after the MCP

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Watch it!

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Recognizers!

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: It's all circuits...  Must be an input/output component...

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: The tower, yes -- Flynn, have you remembered anything else about yourself -- like what sector you're from?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Well...my home "sector" was called Paramus ...

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: PARAMUS... wonder what those initials stand for ...  ...probably Program Assist Routine -- well, it sounds like a lovely place.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: It grows on you.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Feel what? You okay?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Alan-One...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: We're inside a Recognizer...  You are crazy -- stealing a Recognizer --

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Are you kidding? I think it's stealing us -

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Damn! Never fails... minute the warranty runs out...

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Come here.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hey... !

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Little more juice's all it needs...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hey! Good to see you guys! Nothing classes up the place like a cleancut young couple.

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: We have to talk.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Good luck. You can't even think in here.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: So...how's the world of serious science?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Have you been sneaking into the ICOM system?

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Whew. You never were much for small talk.  She still leave her clothes all over the floor?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: You can see why all his friends are fourteen years old.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Touche, honey. Yeah, I've been doing a little hacking here. Which I've got every reason, as you well know...

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: I'm afraid it's a little late for that. Dillinger's shut off Group 7 access. He must know what you're up to.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Boy, I bet I know who's workin' late tonight.

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Don't even say that. You've got to find that file before he does..

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Not much chance of that now. The MCP can just slip it into another system as soon as it locates it...

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Okay ... Flynn, I'm gonna put you at my terminal, down in the laser lab. We'll be up in Alan's office.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Swell...I'll log us both on, and you can get your Tron thing running...

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: As long as we stay off the top floor, Dillinger'll never know we've been in here...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: you have any idea how much I can sue these jokers for?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: Well, just don't forget your old friends when you're rich and famous.

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Are you kidding? You guys'll he running this joint by then...

turns.speaker: FLYNN
turns.text: Hey, you know anybody who wants to get hold of some video games... cheap?

turns.speaker: LORA
turns.text: You're getting out of the business?

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Thank. you, Master Control.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: We might be capturing some military programs soon... that interest you?

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Sure, I'd love to go up against some of these guys ... be a nice break from these accounting creampuffs you keep sending me. Which branch of the service?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Strategic Air Command.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Yes, MCP.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I've got a little challenge for you, Sark -- a new recruit. He's a tough case, but I want him treated in the usual manner. Train him for the games... let him hope for a while... and blow him away.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: You've got it. I've been hopin' you'd send me somebody with a little moxie ... what kind of program is he?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: He's not any kind of program, Sark. He's a User.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: A User?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: That's right. He pushed me...in the other world. Somebody pushes me, I push back. So I brought him down here ... What's the matter, Sark? You look nervous.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Well, I -- it's just -- I don't know, a User, I mean... Users wrote us. A User even wrote you...

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Now get this straight, pal -- no one User wrote me. I'm worth a couple million of their man-years! I'm bigger than all those little wimps put together!  Humans they can't even keen their social order in one piece

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: But-what if I can't...?

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: You rather take your chances with me? Want me to slow down your power cycles for you?

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Wait...I need that...

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Then pull yourself together. Get this clown trained. I want him in the Games until he dies playing.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Yes...acknowledge, Master Control...

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: End of line.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I hope you've enjoyed being a command program, Sark. I wonder how you'll like working in a pocket calculator... maybe one of those watches that plays "Happy Birthday" to its User once a year.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: Now, sir... We did take care of that User you sent us --

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: Yes, and now you've got two renegade programs running all the hell over the system in a stolen simulation.

turns.speaker: SARK
turns.text: We'll get them, sir... These things take time.

turns.speaker: MCP
turns.text: I don't have time, Sark. And neither do you. End of line.

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: New guy...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Another free program off line.  What's his User s'posed to do -- ?

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: The Users...you really think they're still there?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: They'd better be...I don't want to bust outta this dump an' find nothin' but a lot of cold circuits waitin' for me.

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Do it!

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: You think we can make it there?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: We have to.

turns.speaker: RAM
turns.text: Do you know what he's talking about?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: I have to find out what Alan wants... that comes first.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Yori... hey...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Oh, Tron... I knew you'd escape... they've never built circuit that could hold you...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: I can't believe how bad it's gotten around here since the MCP started taking over... all the good functions have shut down... everybody looks so dead... I'm afraid to even go out during down-time...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: That's all going to change, Yori...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Don't know yet... I have to get in touch with Alan. He was going to tell me how to

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: My quarters.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Why is everything...like this?

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: It's a flat. But wait a micro...
